name: Alexandra Park Orchard
short_description: Heritage fruit trees in the East End.
description: A community-led orchard project featuring a variety of apple and pear trees.

name: Clyde Estuary Sea Greens
short_description: Foraging along the upper Firth of Clyde.
description: Find sea beet and sea aster along the marshy banks near the Erskine Bridge.

name: Pollok Country Park Chestnuts
short_description: Sweet chestnuts in Glasgow's largest park.
description: Search the woodland areas near the Burrell Collection for mature sweet chestnut trees.

name: Incredible Edible Southside
short_description: Community planters with herbs and salads.
description: Local street-side planters offering free seasonal herbs and leafy greens for the community.

name: Kelvingrove Park Wild Garlic
description: Abundant wild garlic found along the banks of the River Kelvin within the park.

name: Forth & Clyde Canal Berries
description: Miles of brambles line the canal banks between Maryhill and Speirs Wharf.

name: Victoria Park Orchard
short_description: Fruit trees near the Fossil Grove.
description: A small public orchard with apple trees managed for the benefit of park visitors.

name: Mugdock Country Park Hazelnuts
short_description: Wild hazel nuts in rural woodland.
description: Vast areas of hazel coppice found throughout the country park fringes.

name: Cathkin Braes Blackberries
short_description: Abundant wild fruit on the hillside.
description: High altitude berry picking with great views over the city.

name: Linn Park Elder
short_description: Elderberries and flowers in the Southside.
description: Large elder shrubs found in the sunnier clearings of the park woodland.

name: Gorbals Community Planters
description: Public planters integrated into the new housing developments, marked for public picking.

name: Ruchill Park Fruit Trees
description: Scattered fruit trees within the park open space, offering free apples in late summer.

name: Dams to Darnley Berries
description: Abundant rosehips and hawthorn berries found in the extensive rural fringe hedgerows.

name: Glasgow Green Plums
short_description: Fruit trees in the city's oldest park.
description: Hardy plum and damson trees found in the wilder corners of the Green.

name: Lunderston Bay Sea Kale
description: A rural coastal spot where sea kale and sea radishes can be found growing in the sand and shingle.
